message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about decomposers in the ecosystem. Nightcrawlers, which are a type of earthworm, are known for their role in decomposition. They consume dirt and dead organic matter, passing it through their bodies and helping to break it down into nutrients that can be recycled back into the soil. Option (A) is incorrect because humans do not typically consume dirt and dead matter in this way. Option (B) is incorrect because whales are not known for their role in decomposition. Option (D) is incorrect because babies do not typically consume dirt and dead matter in this way.

This question requires some basic knowledge about organisms that have the ability to process organic matter through their bodies. Nightcrawlers, which are a type of earthworm, have the ability to consume dirt and dead organic matter and process it through their digestive systems. Humans, whales, and babies do not have this ability. Option (A) is incorrect because humans do not consume dirt, dead organic matter as part of their diet. Option (B) is incorrect because whales mainly consume small marine organisms. Option (D) is incorrect because babies consume milk or other liquids as their primary source of nutrition.

This question is asking about an organism that can process dirt and dead matter through their bodies. Option (C) nightcrawlers, also known as earthworms, fit this description. Option (B) whales are marine mammals that primarily feed on small fish and krill. Option (D) babies are human infants and do not have the ability to process dirt and dead matter in their bodies.
